item.title: XRP Ledger Welcomes First MiCA-Compliant EURØP and Brazil’s USDB Stablecoins
item.description:
XRP Ledger has welcomed two stablecoins: EURØP, a MiCA-compliant euro token backed by European banks, and USDB, a dollar coin tied to Brazilian and US bonds. The launches strengthen XRPL’s role in tokenised finance, connecting institutions, DeFi and RWA markets in Europe and Latin America.

The post XRP Ledger Welcomes First MiCA-Compliant EURØP and Brazil’s USDB Stablecoins appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Layer-2 Arms Race Heats Up, but Only One Is Built for Solana’s Traffic Surge – Solaxy Hits $39 Million With 25 Days Left in Presale
item.description:
Solaxy has drawn $39M in presale funding and entered its final discounted phase, positioning itself as the inaugural Layer-2 built for Solana. The rollup has been designed to absorb overflow from DeFi, gaming, and meme coins, preserving low fees and reliability as network usage has accelerated.

The post Layer-2 Arms Race Heats Up, but Only One Is Built for Solana’s Traffic Surge – Solaxy Hits $39 Million With 25 Days Left in Presale appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Maxine Waters Slams Trump’s $TRUMP Gala, Drops ‘Stop Crypto Corruption’ Bill
item.description:
Maxine Waters has tabled legislation hours before Donald Trump’s $TRUMP investor dinner that would bar presidents, vice presidents, lawmakers and immediate families from owning enough crypto to change its code, citing growing scrutiny of political links to digital assets.

item.title: CISA Warns of Suspected Broader SaaS Attacks Exploiting App Secrets and Cloud Misconfigs
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Thursday revealed that Commvault is monitoring cyber threat activity targeting applications hosted in their Microsoft Azure cloud environment.
"Threat actors may have accessed client secrets for Commvault's (Metallic) Microsoft 365 (M365) backup software-as-a-service (SaaS) solution, hosted in Azure," the agency said.
"This

item.title: GitLab Duo Vulnerability Enabled Attackers to Hijack AI Responses with Hidden Prompts
item.description:
Cybersecurity researchers have discovered an indirect prompt injection flaw in GitLab's artificial intelligence (AI) assistant Duo that could have allowed attackers to steal source code and inject untrusted HTML into its responses, which could then be used to direct victims to malicious websites.
GitLab Duo is an artificial intelligence (AI)-powered coding assistant that enables users to write,

item.title: Critical Versa Concerto Flaws Let Attackers Escape Docker and Compromise Hosts
item.description:
Cybersecurity researchers have uncovered multiple critical security vulnerabilities impacting the Versa Concerto network security and SD-WAN orchestration platform that could be exploited to take control of susceptible instances.
It's worth noting that the identified shortcomings remain unpatched despite responsible disclosure on February 13, 2025, prompting a public release of the issues

item.title: Google Chrome's Built-in Manager Lets Users Update Breached Passwords with One Click
item.description:
Google has announced a new feature in its Chrome browser that lets its built-in Password Manager automatically change a user's password when it detects the credentials to be compromised.

item.title: U.S. Dismantles DanaBot Malware Network, Charges 16 in $50M Global Cybercrime Operation
item.description:
The U.S. Department of Justice (DoJ) on Thursday announced the disruption of the online infrastructure associated with DanaBot (aka DanaTools) and unsealed charges against 16 individuals for their alleged involvement in the development and deployment of the malware, which it said was controlled by a Russia-based cybercrime organization.
